eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu

Class LootContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu.LootContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WauzInventory

    public class LootContainer
extends java.lang.Object
implements WauzInventory
    An inventory that can be used as menu or for other custom interaction mechanics. Represents a virtual chest, to hand out loot to a player.
    Author:
    Wauzmons

      • open

        public static void open(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                        java.util.List<org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack> lootItemStacks)
        Opens the menu for the given player. Shows all the given loot item stacks, for the player to claim.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that should view the inventory.
        lootItemStacks - The items to randomly scatter around the loot container.

      • selectMenuPoint

        public void selectMenuPoint(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
        Checks if an event in this inventory was triggered by a player click. The event will be normally executed, just like inside a chest.
        Specified by:
        selectMenuPoint in interface WauzInventory
        Parameters:
        event - The inventory click event.

      • destroyInventory

        public void destroyInventory(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryCloseEvent event)
        Cleans up everything, so the inventory can be closed. All the contents of the container will be dropped.
        Specified by:
        destroyInventory in interface WauzInventory
        Parameters:
        event - The inventory close event.

      • setLootChest

        public void setLootChest(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory lootChest)
        Parameters:
        lootChest - The new inventory instance to hold the loot.
